cards.title: Introduction to JavaScript
cards.content: JavaScript is a widely-used programming language for web development.

cards.title: React Basics
cards.content: React is a popular JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

cards.title: HTML5 Fundamentals
cards.content: HTML5 is the latest version of HTML and the foundation of web pages.

cards.title: CSS3 Styling
cards.content: CSS3 is used to style and layout web pages.

cards.title: JavaScript DOM Manipulation
cards.content: The Document Object Model (DOM) allows dynamic interaction with web pages using JavaScript.

cards.content: Node.js is a server-side JavaScript runtime environment.

cards.title: React Hooks
cards.content: React Hooks provide a way to use state and other React features without writing a class.

cards.title: CSS Flexbox Layout
cards.content: Flexbox is a CSS layout model that allows items to align and distribute within a container.

cards.title: JavaScript Promises
cards.content: Promises in JavaScript handle asynchronous operations in a more elegant way.

cards.content: React components have several lifecycle methods that can be used for specific tasks.

cards.title: Responsive Web Design
cards.content: Responsive design allows web pages to adapt to different screen sizes.

cards.content: ES6 introduced new features and syntax improvements to JavaScript.

cards.title: React Router
cards.content: React Router enables navigation and routing in React applications.

cards.title: CSS Grid Layout
cards.content: CSS Grid Layout allows complex layouts with rows and columns in CSS.

cards.content: Express.js is a web application framework for Node.js.

cards.title: React Context API
cards.content: The Context API in React provides a way to pass data through the component tree without prop drilling.

cards.title: CSS Transitions and Animations
cards.content: CSS allows smooth transitions and animations for web elements.

cards.content: MongoDB is a NoSQL database used for storing data in JSON-like documents.

cards.title: JavaScript Fetch API
cards.content: The Fetch API in JavaScript allows making HTTP requests.

cards.content: Redux is a predictable state container for JavaScript apps.

cards.title: CSS Media Queries
cards.content: Media queries in CSS enable different styles based on screen sizes.

cards.content: GraphQL is a query language for your API, and a server-side runtime for executing those queries.

cards.title: JavaScript Object-Oriented Programming
cards.content: Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) is a programming paradigm that uses objects and classes.

cards.content: Sass/SCSS are CSS preprocessors that add features like variables and nested rules.

cards.content: PostgreSQL is a powerful open-source relational database management system.
